curam.util.administration.intf

Interface CacheAdmin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    curam.util.administration.base.CacheAdmin, CacheAdmin, CacheAdminFactory

    public interface CacheAdmin
    CacheAdmin provides utilities to refresh the security, code table and IEG caches.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void reloadCodetableCache()
      Reload the codetable cache.
      void reloadConfigCache()
      Reload the tab configuration cache.
      void reloadFieldLevelSecurityCache()
      Reload the field level security cache on the client.
      void reloadResourceCache()
      Reload the resource cache on the client.
      void reloadSecurityCache()
      Reload the security cache.
      void removeRuleSetFromCache(java.lang.String ruleSetID)
      Remove the cached rule set object from the rule set cache so that it is instantiated anew from the rule set definition the next time it is accessed.
      void removeUserPreferenceFromCache(java.lang.String userPrefSetId)
      Removes a user preference set from the cache.
      void resetCodeTableCacheVersion()
      When reloading the code table cache in a testing environment, the cache reloads but the version number associated with the cache does not get reset correctly.

    • Method Detail

      • reloadSecurityCache

        void reloadSecurityCache()
                  throws AppException,
                         InformationalException
        Reload the security cache. Cache refreshes are propagated across all active nodes in a cluster (if the application is clustered). Inactive nodes will receive the refresh notification once they become active again.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • resetCodeTableCacheVersion

        void resetCodeTableCacheVersion()
                         throws AppException,
                                InformationalException
        When reloading the code table cache in a testing environment, the cache reloads but the version number associated with the cache does not get reset correctly. This method resets the cache version number. This method is provided for development testing ONLY and should not be used by production code.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • reloadCodetableCache

        void reloadCodetableCache()
                   throws AppException,
                          InformationalException
        Reload the codetable cache. Cache refreshes are propagated across all active nodes in a cluster (if the application is clustered). Inactive nodes will receive the refresh notification once they become active again.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • reloadFieldLevelSecurityCache

        void reloadFieldLevelSecurityCache()
                            throws AppException,
                                   InformationalException
        Reload the field level security cache on the client. Cache refreshes are propagated across all active nodes in a cluster (if the application is clustered). Inactive nodes will receive the refresh notification once they become active again. This method will not trigger a reload of the client field level security cache if the server is not running in a J2EE container.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • removeRuleSetFromCache

        void removeRuleSetFromCache(java.lang.String ruleSetID)
                     throws AppException,
                            InformationalException
        Remove the cached rule set object from the rule set cache so that it is instantiated anew from the rule set definition the next time it is accessed.
        Parameters:
        ruleSetID - an ID of the rule set.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • removeUserPreferenceFromCache

        void removeUserPreferenceFromCache(java.lang.String userPrefSetId)
                            throws AppException,
                                   InformationalException
        Removes a user preference set from the cache.
        Parameters:
        userPrefSetId - the user preference set to be removed.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • reloadResourceCache

        void reloadResourceCache()
                  throws AppException,
                         InformationalException
        Reload the resource cache on the client. Cache refreshes are propagated across all active nodes in a cluster (if the application is clustered). Inactive nodes will receive the refresh notification once they become active again. This method will not trigger a reload of the client resource cache if the server is not running in a J2EE container.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • reloadConfigCache

        void reloadConfigCache()
                throws AppException,
                       InformationalException
        Reload the tab configuration cache. Cache refreshes are propagated across all active nodes in a cluster (if the application is clustered). Inactive nodes will receive the refresh notification once they become active again.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
